Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 12.4 and σ = 1.2. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 10% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 10.3097
* 10.6187
* 10.8621
* 10.9225

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 10.3097: Incorrect
* 10.6187: Incorrect
* 10.8621: Correct
* 10.9225: Incorrect
